channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15300] Upgrade to zookeeper 3.4.8
item.description:
zookeeper 3.4.8 has been released.
Among the fixes the following are desirable:

ZOOKEEPER-706 large numbers of watches can cause session re-establishment to fail
ZOOKEEPER-1797 PurgeTxnLog may delete data logs during roll

This issue upgrades zookeeper dependency to 3.4.8

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: I'm a bit shy about doing this right away after having had to back out an upgrade to zookeeper 3.4.7. They ended up pulling that release and going so far as to nuke release binaries from the mirrors. Can we do this on trunk only?

Agreed, Andrew.

We can wait for a while before upgrading.

-1 overall

I have seen all 3 test failures in recent QA runs of other JIRAs.

TestHFileBackedByBucketCache is being tracked by HBASE-15416 which is open as of the writing of this comment.

+1, ZOOKEEPER-706 is indeed an important fix

Also checked the timed out cases (TestMasterFailoverWithProcedures/TestRegionMergeTransactionOnCluster) in local with zookeeper version updated to 3.4.8, and confirmed all could pass
If there is no more comment, I will integrate later today to master branch.
